title: Bride-to-be's disgust at Thomas Cook after her mother dies but firm refuses to refund trip
text:

A bride-to-be has spoken of her disgust at Thomas Cook, who refused to refund flights booked for her mother - even though she had died.
Parents Karen and Alan Rothwell had paid £1,500 for a week-long break in Greece to see their daughter Catrina walk down the aisle in September, but Karen tragically passed away last weekend.
When Catrina rang the travel company to explain, she said she was told her dad would have to cancel the entire booking and miss the wedding himself or travel alone with no refund.
Devastating: Karen (right) and Alan (left) Rothwell had paid £1,500 for a week-long break in Greece to see their daughter Catrina (centre) walk down the aisle in September, but Karen tragically died last weekend
Engaged couple: A party of 14 family and friends are due to head to Kos to see Catrina, 23, marry her fiancé, Jimmy Hardie, 27
Karen, 55, died from liver failure at Royal Oldham Hospital on Saturday after a short illness.
A party of 14 family and friends are due to head to Kos to see Catrina, 23, marry her fiancé, Jimmy Hardie, 27.

But Catrina, a nursery worker from Rochdale, Lancashire, branded Thomas Cook's lack of compassion for her situation 'disgusting'.
Catrina said: 'It's hard enough trying to deal with the loss of my mum. It has devastated all of us.
'To be told that the only way of getting a refund is to cancel the whole booking is so insensitive.
'I need my dad there by my side, even more so now my mum can't be there. It's unthinkable for us to cancel it.
'But can you imagine him sitting on the flight with an empty space next to him? We were only asking for a partial refund, £750.'
When Catrina rang the firm to explain, she said she was told that her dad Alan would have to cancel the entire booking and miss the wedding himself or travel alone with no refund to see her marry her fiancé Jimmy (right)
Happier times: Catrina (right) described the Thomas Cook staff she spoke to on Thursday as 'very snotty' and said the firm 'should be ashamed' of its initial response
Karen's husband, Alan, said he spoke to Thomas Cook on Tuesday to make them aware of Karen's death, and was told to phone back when he had her death certificate.
Alan, a 67-year-old courier, said he rang back on Thursday only to be told that there was no way the company could issue a partial refund, despite the exceptional circumstances.
Alan said: 'I explained to them that my wife had passed away and that obviously she would no longer be travelling.
'They basically said the only way of getting any money back was to cancel the whole holiday for the two of us. It was either cancel or pay Karen's 50 per cent.
'That would mean missing Catrina's wedding and there's no way I'm doing that.'
Like sisters: Catrina, who is getting married to Jimmy, a chef, on September 28, described her mum, a retired catering manager, as 'glamorous' and 'full of life'
When mum Karen got ill, the couple started making plans for a reception back in the UK
Catrina described the Thomas Cook staff she spoke to on Thursday as 'very snotty' and said the firm 'should be ashamed' of its initial response.
Catrina said: 'The lady we spoke to insisted that her manager would not let her do anything and would have to cancel the holiday altogether to get us a refund.
'We are already spending a fortune with them on the flights and hotel package and we just wanted some compassion.'
The couple chose Kos as their wedding venue because it was a favourite destination of Karen's.
Alan, a 67-year-old courier,was told that there was no way the company could issue a partial refund, despite the exceptional circumstances
Catrina, who is getting married to Jimmy, a chef, on September 28, described her mum, a retired catering manager, as 'glamorous' and 'full of life'.
Catrina said: 'Mum was an amazing, glamorous woman. She wouldn't be seen without her make-up on.
'She was full of life. Everyone thought the world of her. She has devastated us all to be honest.
'She was in and out of hospital a couple of weeks ago but we all thought she would be fine for the wedding.
'We wanted it to be abroad because you can't trust the weather here, but she was the driving force behind it being in Kos.
'She had been there a couple of times and it was a special place for her.
'When she got ill, we started making plans for a reception back in the UK but she won't be there either now.'
Mum Karen was in and out of hospital during the last few weeks and the family thought she would be fine for the wedding
The family were prepared to travel to the wedding without a refund for Karen, who was not covered by travel insurance.
Thomas Cook has confirmed that the Rothwells will now be offered a full refund.
A spokesperson for Thomas Cook said: 'We are so sorry to hear about Ms Rothwell's sad loss especially at such a poignant time and would like to offer our sincere condolences.
'We can only imagine what a difficult period this must be and do not wish to add any additional stress to the family.
'We have since been in contact with Ms Rothwell and her father too and will gladly be amending this booking and offering a full refund. Our thoughts remain with the family at this sad time.'
The couple are set to tie the knot in Kos, Greece on September 28. Thomas Cook have since apologised and offered a refund
